visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing atmospheric gas composition percentages using a donut-style layout with pattern fills

accessibility.description: Composition of Earth's atmosphere by molecular count

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains one categorical variable (gas type) and one quantitative variable (percentage composition) in a 4-dimensional space. Synthetic data maintains geochemical accuracy with nitrogen dominating (μ=78.08%, σ=0.5), oxygen at 20.95%, and trace gases following established atmospheric science measurements. The donut chart implementation follows Tufte's principles by maximizing data-ink through pattern fills and eliminating redundant gridlines. Proportional wedges employ Cairo's perceptual guidelines through: 1) Descending clockwise ordering from largest segment 2) High-contrast label placement 3) Pattern/texture differentiation for monochrome reproduction. Statistical validation shows sum constraint of 100% ±0.01% rounding error, maintaining composition fidelity. Annotated percentages use D3.format precision matching original measurement resolution (two decimal places for main components, three for trace elements).
